New Records: Brayan Bello pitched the longest outing of his career, allowing only two hits in eight innings.
Tyler O'Neill hit a home run, contributing to the Red Sox's victory.
Kenley Jansen recorded his 25th save, securing the win for the Red Sox.
Key Match Events: Tyler O'Neill hit a two-run home run in the eighth inning to extend the Red Sox's lead.
Brayan Bello delivered a strong performance, striking out nine batters and walking one.
Chris Bassitt allowed one run in six innings but faced a tough bullpen.
The game remained 1-0 in the bottom of the eighth inning before O'Neill's home run.
Pre-Game Insights: The Red Sox were four games behind Minnesota for the AL wild-card berth entering the game.
Brayan Bello had struggled against the Blue Jays in previous starts but delivered a career-best performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Boston manager Alex Cora praised Bello's performance and the team's resilience.
Chris Bassitt left the game with two outs in the seventh inning, maintaining a 1-0 lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Fenway Park with a crowd of 32,809 attendees.
There was a rain delay before the game, but it was played as scheduled.
David Hamilton suffered a finger injury during a bunt attempt but had no further updates.
Others: The series finale was scheduled for the next day with a matchup against the Blue Jays' Bowden Francis.
